title: trie/database on insert - panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
body:
Related issue  #17280, but is was closed.

#### System information

Geth version: v1.8.12
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour
stable env

#### Actual behaviour
multiple nodes are crashing

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
private PoA net
submit 10000+ tx
it will crash

#### Backtrace

````
BUG[11-14|05:07:28.402] VM returned with error                   err="evm: execution reverted"
DEBUG[11-14|05:07:28.402] VM returned with error                   err="evm: execution reverted"

DEBUG[11-14|05:07:28.404] VM returned with error                   err="evm: execution reverted"
panic: runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference
[signal SIGSEGV: segmentation violation code=0x1 addr=0x0 pc=0x69aff2]
````

CC: @karalabe 
Hi,  v1.8.12 still has this problem?
@hello2mao Could you please scroll up the output log to see is there any `out of memory` error?

> @hello2mao Could you please scroll up the output log to see is there any `out of memory` error?

No such error. My block gas limit is 209773332254395460, it is large enough.

> > @hello2mao Could you please scroll up the output log to see is there any `out of memory` error?
> 
> No such error. My block gas limit is 209773332254395460, it is large enough.

Okay, by the way I mentioned about the computing memory, RAM, of your node. I also have node crashed on a low performance machine that's why I'm asking about `out of memory` error.

We've put in quite a few changes/tweaks into this part of the code since the .12 release. (we're at .18 as of this morning). Could you please check if the latest release still behaves like this? If yes, could you create a repro for us?

> We've put in quite a few changes/tweaks into this part of the code since the .12 release. (we're at .18 as of this morning). Could you please check if the latest release still behaves like this? If yes, could you create a repro for us?

At v1.8.17, I has this issue #18082, so I go back to  v1.8.12. -_-
I will try .18.
Thank you for your advice.
Hi @karalabe ,could you help me check is this pr #17282 made by you fix this problem?
I believe this is fixed by that ^ commit. I'll close this as it's on fairly old code. Feel free to open a new ticket if it persists on latest release or master.
